newsitem.title: USA: Pfizer says FDA clears Zoloft for new use.
newsitem.headline: Pfizer says FDA clears Zoloft for new use.

text.p: Healthcare company Pfizer Inc said on Wednesday that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration had granted the company permission to market Zoloft for the treatment of panic disorder.

"This new use marks an additional milestone in Zoloft's growing applicability to the needs of physicians and their patients," said Dr Joseph Feczko, senior vice president of Pfizer Pharmaceuticals Group.
The company has estimated that panic disorder will afflict four to eight million American adults at some point in their lives.
Patients suffering from panic disorder experience recurrent, unexpected panic attacks. Symptoms include heart palpitations, dizziness and fear of losing control.
Zoloft also received new labeling clearance for maintaining antidepressant efficacy for up to a year in the treatment of depression, Pfizer said in a statement.
